p: The International Energy Agency estimates that the coronavirus crisis's shock will significantly reduce the total global oil consumption by 2020. However, it is unlikely that plummeting oil prices will stimulate demand and increase consumption.42 Falling oil prices have given countries a chance to cut or eliminate subsidies for fossil fuel consumption. These subsidies can either be directed to promote renewable energy or be forgone to allow the free market to determine the prices of conventional and alternative forms of life.
